intro: Psychotria domatiata, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or greenish-white in color. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The plant has been historically used for its psychoactive properties, particularly in traditional medicine and cultural practices.
